alert.note: Alert for Cambria (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 12 at 9:07PM EDT until August 12 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL CAMBRIA COUNTY... At 906 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Loretto, moving east southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Sankertown, Cresson and Gallitzin around 910 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Tunnelhill, Mt. Aloysius College, Saint Francis University and Allegheny Portage Railroad National Historic Site. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
